intro: Tricalysia katangensis, commonly known as the Katanga trumpet tree, is a tropical tree native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that resemble trumpets. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, berry-like fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
